text: what's up everyone somebody shot me a DM asking what I thought of the volatility movement in GameStop today and as you know I'm here for it happy to take a look so overall to me it looks like volatility is cratering that's what I'm seeing I'm it's essentially across the chain at this point and we're seeing broad approximation to the longer term expirations this front expiration cycle used to look really really hot and now it does not let me show you what I'm talking about so the 16th of June this was over the weekend on Sunday right before the shareholders meeting and VA was expanding pretty meaningfully up to 280 that's a lot one over a weekend to for a shareholders meeting a shareholders meeting typically isn't that big of an event you'll see that for really big news releases biotech phase trials stuff like that so the fact that it was getting that high was very interesting to me we had the shareholders meeting which a lot of you informed me that the perception was it was a nothing Burger not much was talked about and as I looked through the transcript I could see what you mean there was very little said it was all kind of broad brush stroke muscle movements not a lot of specifics so I now better understood that perspective and that led to volatility Contracting massively but I actually thought this was going to contract more the fact that

text: not normal normally it would maybe not be inverse you don't necessarily see that big of a disparity but you typically would see more puts than calls the markets tend to hedge the downside so this is still topical to me the fact that I see this much skew over this short of a time period because as soon as we start going further out let's say that we go out instead to like this 19 July 16 August and October take a look at the call oi and the put oi like it's much closer to parity and as you go further and further out that parity then eventually inverts like I would expect it to in normal markets so again that tells me that the market is kind of pricing in the action from within October essentially that's what I see here so far the other thing that we got to take a look at is the transaction volume for today calls and puts and it's very similar to what we saw yesterday much more call volume but again quick recap we got to get rid of between the market we can't tell if those are buying to open or selling to open but we can make some inferences based on if it transacts at the bid or the offer and in this case the fact that 39 of the calls transacted today were at the bid or below that tells me that those are again mostly sales
